Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2008 03:23PM minnow wrote: Friends, It's me again, and i am so grateful for this format of caring/sharing. On wed 12/3 I had an mri biopsy. took 4 hours, both breasts done. The swelling and bruising were very unexpected, as was the discomfort from laying on that d- - - table for so long, i am feeling much better, physically. Today is sunday, no word yet on results. my husband is overly causual regardless of the results. it is all i can do to appear calm. i just want to go to bed and sleep. i have perused the topics and responses and they are all helpful. guess i just wanted to update, since husband seems disinterested :( or :) depends on my perspective i guess. God bless you all for your concern and sharing.
Posts.Title: contrast mri waiting for biopsy confused minnow bee5467

Posts.Content: minnow wrote: I have had a mammo, an enhanced mammo, appt with cancer surgeon, contrast mri, ultrasound (in this order) a mri biopsy is scheduled for 12/3 for both breasts. I received a report in the mail today that said referring to the contrast mri "At that time, a 1 cm spiculated mass was noted in the lower inner quadrant of the right breast and a 1 cm irregular mass was noted centrally in the left breast". Near the end of the letter the following "Assessment: category 4 - suspicious abnormality, biopsy should be considered" I am trying to put my anxiety aside. My mom was first dx with bc at 45 (and another breast dx 5 years later, died at 60 of pancreatic cancer), my younger sister at 42, I am 47. Any input as to what the report is saying, more specifically, as written above. Any insight is appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: contrast mri waiting for biopsy confused minnow bee5467

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2008 10:26PM minnow wrote: Friends, Â Thank you so much for your words of encouragement, information and hugs. I am sooo grateful. I am waiting a bit more patiently. I did see my gp for anxiety meds. She was wonderful and understanding. I would never have asked for the med help with out your help. What ever the biopsy results yeild I now know I have resources and have begun to find my voice. My heart is more at easy. with much thanks, pj
